revised_title: Comenius, Wilkins, and the Origins of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the visit of Comenius to London in 1641-1642 and its impact on the origins of the Royal Society. It highlights the similarities between Comenius and John Wilkins' views on scientific method and the desirability of a universal language. The author argues that the contrast in their ideas is not between Baconian empiricism and Comenian Pansophia, but between Comenian Pansophia and the Cartesian attitude of mind.
